constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KTCAAP Name: Kingston Town Centre AAP
KEYACH Name: Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Change of use on ground floor level from Nail salon (Sui Generis) to Retail (Use Class E(b) - Sale of food and drink for consumption (mostly) on the premises) and provision of a one-bedroom self contained flat
decision_conditions: The proposed development would result in the net loss of approximately 43sqm of sui generis Nail Salon employment floorspace and the applicant has failed to demonstrate through the submission of sound evidence or rigorous marketing that there is no quantitative or qualitative need for a range of employment uses, contrary to Policies DM17 and DM19 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

The proposed dwelling would fall approximately 10sqm short of the minimum space standards for a dwelling of this type and the applicant has failed to demonstrate, through the submission of cogent evidence, that the proposed dwelling would receive adequate levels of daylight and sunlight. Furthermore, the proposed private amenity space is not considered to be of a good standard and that the outlook for habitable rooms would be poor, contrary to Policies DM10 and DM13 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012), Policy 3.5 of the London Plan (2016) and the London Plan Housing SPG (2016).

No mechanism to preclude residents of the proposed dwelling from applying for on street residents parking permits (including visitor permits) and for permits to park in Council-owned car parks in the area has been submitted. It has therefore not been demonstrated that the proposed dwelling would not increase on-street car parking stress and would not harm highway safety, contrary to Policies DM9 and DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and the NPPF (2019).

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 4 (Bike store) and Condition 6 (Fire Strategy) of planning permission 23/01099/HOU which states:Condition 4 (Bike Store) - Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, details of secure cycle parking facilities to serve the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The cycle parking facilities as shown in the approved details shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained for that purpose and kept free from obstruction thereafter.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Condition 6 (Fire Strategy) - Prior to any above ground works (excluding demolition) a Fire Safety Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Fire Safety Strategy shall demonstrate how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety and shall include the following details: 1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point; 2) Appropriate fire alarm systems; 3) Passive and active fire safety measures; 4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread; 5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuation strategy;6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development. The Fire Safety Strategy shall include a statement of competence. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Strategy and thereafter maintained. Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire safety) of the London Plan 2021.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 9 (Cycle Parking) and 10 (Waste) of planning permission 19/01690/FUL  which states:Condition 9 (Cycle Parking) - Notwithstanding the approved drawings and prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, details of the cycle parking facilities (including location) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The approved cycle parking facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter be retained for this use at all times.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate cycling facilities in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.Condition 10 (Waste) - Notwithstanding the approved drawings and prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved,  a waste and recycling management plan to show sufficient capacity for waste and recycling, the location of the recycle and waster infrastructure, and details of how the site would be serviced on refuse and recycling collection days shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The plan shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter be adhered to at all times for the lifetime of the development.  Reason:  To ensure the provision of refuse facilities to the satisfaction of the Council in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Application to discharge Condition 11 (Biodiversity Net Gain Scheme) and Condition 12 (Woodland Management Plan) of planning permission 21/02435/FUL (Development of new themed land including a new rollercoaster and childrens rides along with associated buildings, structures, landscaping and incidental works)The Council's Tree and Landscape Officer and the Council's Bio diversity Officer have commented that the submitted information meets with the requirements of the conditions.The condition can therefore be discharged.

Please ensure the validation check list includes all the necessary documentation as required by the new local list. Please check the new local list in our website before filling the householder validation checklist.The new local validation list and checklists can be obtained via the council's website- https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applications.
Please provide 'Biodiversity Checklist.' The Biodiversity Checklists can be obtained via the council's website:https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/file/2738/biodiversity-checklist

Please send the link for the photo to download or send the site photo separately.Photographs should show all sides of the application property, plus front and rear street scene photos showing the application property and the neighbouring properties. Photographs should have been taken within 3 months of the date of the submission of the application. Photographs should be clearly labelled.
